content:
When you ask a question, you are provided with an area to type information which explains more about the problem and offer infor about your OS, version of Thunderbird you are using and your set up. It's useful to state what steps you take and what you expect and what you get.

"Fix it" does not offer anyone any information.

Please provide some info about this situation. What OS are you using ? What version of Thunderbird are you using? Are you talking about an imap or pop mail account?

What do you mean by "does not read my emails"? You read emails not Thunderbird. Do you mean you cannot connect to server to download emails ? If yes, then what error message message are you seeing? Post an image of the error message or state what it says word for word.

Do you mean emails are downloaded but you cannot see them in Message List? Do you mean you can see them in Message List but when you select them no content is shown?

You also say "or mark them as read" - maybe this is the actual problem? So that implies you are downloading emails and are able to read them.

Do you use Message Filters to move new emails to folders? Do you find the 'not mark as read' only effects emails you have filtered to other folders, but those in Inbox are ok. Do you have any Message Filter which sets up a Mark as Read or Unread?

The 'Mark as read' issue: Do you have the following settings ?

  • Settings > General
  • scroll to 'Reading & Display'
  • Select 'Automatically mark messages as read'
  • Select 'Immediately on display'

Do you use an addon extensions ? If yes, then please perform a test

  • Help > Troubleshoot Mode
  • Click on 'REstart' and seelct 'Continue in Troubleshoot Mode'

Use this mode for a while to see if the 'mark as read' works when you open an email. REport on results.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
If the 'Message List Header' is not displaying you can enable it: View > Layout > Message List Header

Alternative, you can 'Customise' the 'Unified Toolbar' and put 'Quick Filter' button onto it, then you can hide the Message List Header if it's not desirable and still have the access to the Quick Filter.
creator: Toad-Hall

II have been a Thunderbird user since, I believe, late 2004/Early 2005 and have not launched Troubleshoot Mode for many years so my bad for forgetting this option

I do like the new look by the way

Thanks :) - both for your quick response and solution!

Keef

content:
settings>General scroll down to 'config editor' look for this line: mail.identity.default.suppress_signature_separator; false Double click to toggle 'false' to 'true' or right click on line and select 'Toggle' Close config editor - top right X click on OK to save changes in Options.

That feature is used by many email clients, not just Thunderbird, as the line from which signatures are stripped when replying to message.
creator: davidsk

creator: isthisurcard3

content:
There was a recent issue with a different provider (Optimum), where users with non-secure settings were suddenly unable to send or receive. Changing to the recommended secure settings fixed it.

The fact the account is working in webmail is not relevant to its performance in TB, as the two use different systems.

I suggest you contact Westnet to confirm if your non-secure settings are still supported. Also, try running Windows in safe mode to test if Bitdefender is interfering with secure connections. Disabling BD is not sufficient to rule out its effect.
creator: sfhowes

content:
I changed the secure settings using both choices (SSL/TLS and STARTTLS) with no success. I even turned off my Bitdefender firewall while experimenting.

As I mentioned, I have not changed the settings in Thunderbird at all. And what doesn't make sense is the other email address, which is on the same Thunderbird program as the problematic one, is having no issues whatsoever AND the settings are exactly the same. The only difference is the wendyp uses "wn" and not "westnet". The "wn" is because it's an old Westnet email address.

I have been able to get into my webmail on my ISPs website, and send/receive emails on the wendyp email with no issues. Hence the reason it has to be Thunderbird.

I've had these settings on Thunderbird for many years and had my email address for decades. I don't understand what has changed.
creator: isthisurcard3

content:
Your picture shows the settings for the incoming POP server with connection security = none, and I assume it's the same for the outgoing (which is why the error is 'relay denied'). According to their site, you should be using secure settings:

incoming POP server: mail.westnet.com.au port: 995 Connection security: SSL/TLS Authentication: normal password User Name: email address

outgoing SMTP server: mail.westnet.com.au port: 587 Connection security: STARTTLS Authentication: normal password User Name: email address
creator: sfhowes
